alert.note: Alert for Clarke; Monroe; Wilcox (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 04 at 1:46AM CST until further notice by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Mobile AL has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Alabama... Alabama River Near Claiborne Dam affecting Clarke, Wilcox and Monroe Counties. For the Alabama River...including Millers Ferry Dam, Claiborne Dam... Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Alabama River Near Claiborne Dam. * WHEN...From Monday morning until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 27.0 feet, flooding of low lying area. Roads near the confluence of the Alabama and Tombigbee Rivers will begin to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:00 AM CST Friday the stage was 25.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late Monday morning and continue rising to 45.3 feet early Wednesday morning. Additional rises are possible thereafter. - Flood stage is 42.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued when updates occur.
